title: What is the number of valence electrons for the element K? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should know how to find the answer to this question by now. Go to the Periodic Table of the Elements by clicking this link: Dynamic Periodic Table Now, look for a square with the symbol K in it, click on this square and read the contents. In there you will find the answer to your question. Use this powerful tool for your future questions about chemical elements.
Element denoted by the chemical symbol K is potassium. It has 19 electrons. The simplified electron configuration is 2.8.8.1. The spdf manner would be 1s^2 2s^2 2p^6 3s^2 3p^6 4s^1
